definitions: willingness to respect or accept behaviour or opinions different from one's own; openness to new ideas

examples.text: one of the basic tenets of liberalism is tolerance

shortDefinitions: willingess to respect behaviour or opinions different from one's own

definitions: the holding of political views that are socially progressive and promote social welfare

examples.text: Brooklyn prides itself on being a great bastion of liberalism and diversity

shortDefinitions: holding of socially progressive political views that support social welfare

definitions: the belief that many traditional beliefs are dispensable, invalidated by modern thought, or liable to change.
shortDefinitions: belief that many traditional beliefs are dispensible

definitions: a political and social philosophy that promotes individual rights, civil liberties, democracy, and free enterprise

examples.text: representative democracy operates under the principles of classical liberalism

definitions: the doctrine of a Liberal Party or (in the UK) the Liberal Democrats
